title: Dell technologies sees $54.3m in stock sales by Silver Lake entities
author: Investing.com
excerpt: Dell technologies sees $54.3m in stock sales by Silver Lake entities
text: As the market digests this information, Dell Technologies (NYSE:)' stock performance and Silver Lake's future moves will be closely watched by investors and analysts alike. The company maintains a strong market position with $94 billion in revenue over the last twelve months, though InvestingPro analysis indicates some challenges with gross profit margins. The company maintains a strong market position with $94 billion in revenue over the last twelve months, though InvestingPro analysis indicates some challenges with gross profit margins. The sales were conducted by various Silver Lake affiliates, including SLTA V (GP), L.L.C., Silver Lake Technology Associates V, L.P., and Silver Lake Partners V DE (AIV), L.P. These entities are substantial shareholders in Dell Technologies and hold significant influence, with each being a ten-percent owner and having director status. The transactions reflect a strategic move by Silver Lake, which has been a long-time investor in Dell. The sales involved multiple blocks of shares, with weighted average prices reported in different ranges. The largest sales occurred at an average price of $125.68 per share, with additional shares sold at prices up to $127.26 per share. Silver Lake's decision to sell shares comes as Dell Technologies continues to navigate the competitive landscape of the technology sector. The company's stock has been under observation by investors looking to understand market dynamics and shareholder activities. These transactions were part of a broader reallocation strategy, with Silver Lake entities also involved in in-kind distributions around the same period. The reporting entities have made clear that these transactions were not the result of any equity swaps, maintaining transparency in their dealings. InvestingPro data reveals that Dell's management has been actively supporting shareholder value through aggressive share buybacks and dividend growth, with the company raising its dividend for three consecutive years. Subscribers can access 12 additional ProTips and comprehensive analysis in the Pro Research Report. As the market digests this information, Dell Technologies' stock performance and Silver Lake's future moves will be closely watched by investors and analysts alike. In other recent news, Dell Technologies reported a 10% increase in third-quarter earnings to $24.4 billion, primarily driven by the Infrastructure Solutions Group's focus on AI infrastructure and server solutions. The company's earnings per share rose to $2.15, marking a 14% year-over-year increase. Dell also declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.445 per common share following a 20% increase in the company's annual cash dividend. On the equity front, Dell disclosed the issuance of 25 million Class C common shares upon the conversion of an equal number of Class A common shares by CEO Michael Dell. This action is part of the company's internal equity structure. In the analyst circle, TD Cowen maintained its Hold rating on Dell, citing underperformance in the PC segment and delayed revenue from AI initiatives. However, Mizuho (NYSE:) Securities, Goldman Sachs, and Citi maintained positive ratings on Dell, adjusting their price targets accordingly. In other developments, xAI announced plans to expand its Colossus supercomputer facility in Memphis by adding over one million Graphics Processing Units (GPUs). This move signifies the largest ever capital investment in the Memphis region. Fortune 500 companies Nvidia (NASDAQ:), Dell, and Supermicro Computer are also set to establish operations in the city, reinforcing its emerging status as a global hub for artificial intelligence. These are recent developments that reflect Dell's strategic focus on AI infrastructure and server solutions, contributing to a significant surge in its Infrastructure Solutions Group's revenue. As the market digests this information, Dell Technologies (NYSE:)' stock performance and Silver Lake's future moves will be closely watched by investors and analysts alike. The company maintains a strong market position with $94 billion in revenue over the last twelve months, though InvestingPro analysis indicates some challenges with gross profit margins. The company maintains a strong market position with $94 billion in revenue over the last twelve months, though InvestingPro analysis indicates some challenges with gross profit margins.

The sales were conducted by various Silver Lake affiliates, including SLTA V (GP), L.L.C., Silver Lake Technology Associates V, L.P., and Silver Lake Partners V DE (AIV), L.P. These entities are substantial shareholders in Dell Technologies and hold significant influence, with each being a ten-percent owner and having director status.

The transactions reflect a strategic move by Silver Lake, which has been a long-time investor in Dell. The sales involved multiple blocks of shares, with weighted average prices reported in different ranges. The largest sales occurred at an average price of $125.68 per share, with additional shares sold at prices up to $127.26 per share.

Silver Lake's decision to sell shares comes as Dell Technologies continues to navigate the competitive landscape of the technology sector. The company's stock has been under observation by investors looking to understand market dynamics and shareholder activities.

These transactions were part of a broader reallocation strategy, with Silver Lake entities also involved in in-kind distributions around the same period. The reporting entities have made clear that these transactions were not the result of any equity swaps, maintaining transparency in their dealings. InvestingPro data reveals that Dell's management has been actively supporting shareholder value through aggressive share buybacks and dividend growth, with the company raising its dividend for three consecutive years. Subscribers can access 12 additional ProTips and comprehensive analysis in the Pro Research Report.

As the market digests this information, Dell Technologies' stock performance and Silver Lake's future moves will be closely watched by investors and analysts alike.

In other recent news, Dell Technologies reported a 10% increase in third-quarter earnings to $24.4 billion, primarily driven by the Infrastructure Solutions Group's focus on AI infrastructure and server solutions. The company's earnings per share rose to $2.15, marking a 14% year-over-year increase. Dell also declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.445 per common share following a 20% increase in the company's annual cash dividend.

On the equity front, Dell disclosed the issuance of 25 million Class C common shares upon the conversion of an equal number of Class A common shares by CEO Michael Dell. This action is part of the company's internal equity structure.

In the analyst circle, TD Cowen maintained its Hold rating on Dell, citing underperformance in the PC segment and delayed revenue from AI initiatives. However, Mizuho (NYSE:) Securities, Goldman Sachs, and Citi maintained positive ratings on Dell, adjusting their price targets accordingly.

In other developments, xAI announced plans to expand its Colossus supercomputer facility in Memphis by adding over one million Graphics Processing Units (GPUs). This move signifies the largest ever capital investment in the Memphis region. Fortune 500 companies Nvidia (NASDAQ:), Dell, and Supermicro Computer are also set to establish operations in the city, reinforcing its emerging status as a global hub for artificial intelligence.

These are recent developments that reflect Dell's strategic focus on AI infrastructure and server solutions, contributing to a significant surge in its Infrastructure Solutions Group's revenue.
